name: 9.16 "Days of Wine and Neurosis" Quiz / Test | Television | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
jukebox.

	The gang was all upset about the jukebox not working. Frasier pointed out they never used it anyway.

questions.text: How long did they say it would take to fix the broken item?
questions.explanation:
1 week.

	They were given a karaoke machine in replacement of the jukebox. Norm said, "We'd never use that" to which Frasier replied, "You never used the jukebox!" However, they did end up using the karaoke machine.

options: that Norm went all day without one beer
questions.explanation:
that Cliff showered.

	Cliff was constantly being verbally attacked by Carla. A lot of it was his own fault, as he never knew when to keep his mouth shut.

questions.text: What song did Cliff and Norm sing?
options: Breaking Up is Hard to Do
questions.explanation:
Lollipop.

	"Lollipop" was written by Beverly Ross and Julius Dixson. It was first performed in 1958 by Ronald and Ruby. Beverly Ross was "Ruby". Cliff and Norm sing it non-stop until Frasier finally takes the mic from them because he's sick of hearing it. Plus, he tells them they don't do the "pop" right.

questions.text: Who was going to get married in 3 days?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	Robin proposed to Rebecca by flying in Bobby Hatfield (or "the other Righteous Brother" as Rebecca called him) to sing "Unchained Melody". Robin asked her if he could marry her now that he was unchained (referencing the fact he'd been in prison up until now).

questions.text: Who threw the person getting married a bridal shower?
questions.explanation:
Lilith.

	Lilith thought it was only fair she threw Rebecca a bridal shower, since Rebecca threw her one. Rebecca told her that she just threw that together and didn't put much thought into it.

questions.text: What song did Frasier sing the first time?
options: Meet Me in St. Louis, Louis
Will You Still Love Me Tomorrow?
questions.explanation:
Isn't It Romantic?.

	"Isn't It Romantic?" was written by Richard Rodgers and Lorenz Hart. It was written in 1932 for a movie called "Love Me Tonight".  Frasier got hooked on the karaoke machine and sang different songs, but still he sang non-stop.

questions.text: Who got drunk in this episode?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	Rebecca started to have doubts about marrying Robin. She started to toast to everyone until she was so drunk she couldn't say champagne, instead she said, "champlane".

questions.text: Who told Frasier, "Shut up and leave me alone"?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	Frasier responded, "I've had no formal training." Rebecca was upset by the song Frasier was singing. Frasier however thought she was complaining about his singing voice.

questions.text: Who tricked Rebecca into leaving the lights on at her house?
questions.explanation:
Sam.

	Every time Sam tried to turn the light on, she'd turn it right back off. Knowing how drunk she was he left the light off and said "click" and Rebecca turned the light on.  She told Sam she didn't know if she loved Robin or not. Shortly after she started to hit on Sam, and then she passed out. Sam said, "That's funny usually they pass out afterward."
